Welcome to this app! 
 
With this app you can control remote outlets. 
 
To use this app you need a Raspberry Pi with installed WiringPi and Raspberry-Remote, a 433 MHz sender and remote control outlets. 
 
Set the ip address, port, username and password in the settings. 
 
A detailed tutorial to set up the Raspberry Pi can be found in the menu. 
 
Have fun using the app! :-)

To use this app you need a Raspberry Pi with a 433 MHz sender and installed WiringPi and Raspberry-Remote. 
The 433 MHz sender must be connected right. (search the internet how) 
 
Run the following commands on the Raspberry Pi: 
Install git with the command: 
sudo apt-get install git-core 
 
Install WiringPi with the command: 
git clone git://git.drogon.net/wiringPi 
cd wiringPi 
./build 
 
Install Raspberry-Remote with the command: 
cd ~ 
git clone git://github.com/xkonni/raspberry-remote.git 
cd raspberry-remote 
make send 
 
The default path to the send-file is already set in the settings. 
 
That's it. Now add remote control outlets to the app. 
The switches represents the switches on the remote control outlet. 
 
For a more detailed tutorial search the internet for "Raspberry Pi remote control outlet wiringPi Raspberry-remote". There are videos! :-)
